# Revise leadership one-pager for clarity (2025-11-14 07:18Z)

_**User (2025-11-14 01:51Z)**_

The cover letter needs updates. It feels like it’s “too resumey” right now – it still reads like a tech/ job resume that just has some band stuff stapled on. Let’s treat this as a **Leadership One-Pager** that happens to look like a resume, and make it lean, leadership-oriented, and non-redundant.



I’ll walk through **all the concrete updates** I’d make to the current `leadership_resume.pdf`. 

(Also: some older files you uploaded previously have expired on my side; if you ever want me to reference one of those specific older versions again, just re-upload it.)

---

## 1. Header: simplify + make it clearly “leadership packet”

**Current:**

* Big name

* Tagline line

* Then a full contact stack (GitHub, LinkedIn, personal site, company site, etc.) 

* Then a *duplicate* mini-bio paragraph before “Leadership Profile” that says the same thing. 

**Changes:**

1. **Keep only:**

   * `Brandon Gottshall`

   * `Blazin’ Brigade Section Leader Candidate • Low Brass • Marine Corps Veteran`

2. Under that, one clean contact line:

   * `Adel, GA • (229) 234-7471 • blgottshall@gmail.com • brandongottshall.com • linkedin.com/in/Brandon-Gottshall`

3. **Drop from this version**:

   * GitHub

   * moonsoutmedia.com

     (They scream “software job search,” not “leadership packet.”)

4. **Delete the standalone mini-bio paragraph at the very top** (lines 15–19) and keep the same text only once under “Leadership Profile.” 

Result: clean, non-redundant, and clearly about *you as a leader*, not as a dev.

---

## 2. Leadership Profile: keep, but don’t repeat

Right now, “Marine Corps veteran, accredited technology instructor…” appears **twice**: once as a stray paragraph, once under **Leadership Profile**. 

**Change:**

* Keep the **Leadership Profile** heading and paragraph **exactly as is**.

* Delete the earlier copy as noted above.

This gives you **one** short, leadership-oriented summary that matches your cover letter perfectly.

---

## 3. Strip it down to 3 sections total

For this packet, I’d keep only:

1. **Leadership & Ensemble Experience** 

2. **Education** (compact) 

3. **Skills / Certifications** (but *highly trimmed* and leadership-focused) 

Everything else is optional clutter here.

---

## 4. Leadership & Ensemble Experience: reorder + compress

Right now you have: HS Band → OIR → QC NCO → Assistant Maintenance Chief → Effortless → Nebula. 

That’s good content, but it still feels like a work resume.

### a) Reorder for *this* use case

Suggested order:

1. **High School Band Program – Section Leader — Low Brass** 

2. **United States Marine Corps – Corporal — Quality Control NCO** 

3. **United States Marine Corps – Corporal — Assistant Maintenance Chief** 

4. **United States Marine Corps – Deployment Leadership — Operation Inherent Resolve** 

5. **Nebula Academy – Accredited Technology Instructor** 

6. **Moons Out Media – Technical Director (Software Engineering)** 

7. **Effortless Development – Technical Lead & Co-Founder** 

That makes the **top of the page** read:

“Section Leader – Low Brass” → USMC leadership → Teaching → Tech leadership. That lines up with the cover letter narrative.

### b) Compress bullets to feel less like a job CV

Goal: **2–3 bullets per role**, only leadership/mentorship/operations.

Examples:

* **High School Band** – keep 3–4 bullets you already have, they’re perfect. 

* **OIR deployment** – keep 2–3 strongest bullets (power redundancy, mission-essential systems, readiness) and drop extra phrasing. 

* **QC NCO / Asst Maintenance Chief** – each: keep 3 bullets max focused on:

  * managing readiness/$7M equipment

  * writing SOPs

  * training/ coaching Marines

  * leading meetings / representing your section  

* **Nebula Academy / Moons Out / Effortless** – 2–3 bullets each, all focused on:

  * mentoring

  * curriculum / training

  * team leadership

  * systems / SOP vibes

    (You already have good bullets; you’re just cutting duplicates.)

Think: **“Leadership highlight reel,” not “complete work history.”**

---

## 5. Education: keep, but shrink to a block

Your education section is fine but more detailed than needed. 

For this one-pager, I’d do:

* **General Assembly — Software Engineering Immersive (2019–2020)**

* **Brooklyn College, CUNY — Computer Science (12 credits, 2018–2019)**

* **American InterContinental University — General Studies (2013–2014)**

No bullets needed unless you have room and *want* one line like “500+ hour full-stack program…”

---

## 6. Skills: make it leadership-oriented, not tech-stack-oriented

Right now you still have the full tech stack + methodologies. 

For this packet, I’d reduce to 2–3 short lines:

**Technical**

* “React, TypeScript, modern web development; experienced in building tools and systems to support teams.” 

**Leadership & Instruction**

* “Team leadership, mentoring, curriculum design, project management, strategic planning, public speaking.” 

**Military**

* “Quality assurance, maintenance management, safety compliance, risk assessment.” 

Then keep **Certifications & Clearances** but only the relevant ones:

* Nebula Academy – Accredited Technology Instructor (dates) 

* DoD Secret Clearance (former) – optional; good “this person is trusted” signal. 

You can drop EPA 608 for this specific packet if you want to de-clutter. 

---

## 7. Optional: small “Musicianship & Training” line

If you want to connect your current work on chops to the cover letter:

Add a single line either under Leadership Profile or at the very bottom:

> **Musicianship & Training** – Low brass (baritone); currently in a structured daily practice program under guidance from a high school band director focusing on tone, endurance, and fundamentals.

Short, honest, and directly echoes the cover letter.

---

## 8. Overall feel we’re aiming for

After these edits, the doc should feel like:

* A **one-page leadership dossier**, not a job application

* All about:

  * Section leadership

  * Military leadership

  * Teaching/mentorship

  * Systems/SOP mindset

* No big tech-stack block screaming “hire me as a React dev”

escape_latex(text):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Escape special LaTeX characters, but preserve LaTeX commands.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if not text:\n        return \&quot;\&quot;\n\n    # Protect LaTeX commands first using a marker without special chars\n    import re\n\n    latex_commands = []\n\n    def match_balanced_braces(s, start_pos):\n        \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Find the matching closing brace for an opening brace.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n        depth = 0\n        pos = start_pos\n        while pos &lt; len(s):\n            if s[pos] == \&quot;{\&quot;:\n                depth += 1\n            elif s[pos] == \&quot;}\&quot;:\n                depth -= 1\n                if depth == 0:\n                    return pos\n            pos += 1\n        return -1\n\n    # Find and protect all LaTeX commands like \\command{...}\n    result_parts = []\n    pos = 0\n    while pos &lt; len(text):\n        # Look for backslash followed by letters (LaTeX command)\n        cmd_match = re.search(r\&quot;\\\\([a-zA-Z]+)\\{\&quot;, text[pos:])\n        if not cmd_match:\n            result_parts.append(text[pos:])\n            break\n\n        cmd_start = pos + cmd_match.start()\n        cmd_name = cmd_match.group(1)\n        brace_start = cmd_start + len(cmd_match.group(0)) - 1  # Position of {\n\n        # Add text before the command\n        result_parts.append(text[pos:cmd_start])\n\n        # Find matching closing brace\n        brace_end = match_balanced_braces(text, brace_start)\n        if brace_end != -1:\n            # Extract full command\n            full_cmd = text[cmd_start : brace_end + 1]\n            idx = len(latex_commands)\n            latex_commands.append(full_cmd)\n            # Use marker without underscores or special chars\n            result_parts.append(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;)\n            pos = brace_end + 1\n        else:\n            # Malformed, just continue\n            result_parts.append(text[cmd_start:])\n            break\n\n    text = \&quot;\&quot;.join(result_parts)\n\n    # Basic LaTeX escaping\n    replacements = {\n        \&quot;&amp;\&quot;: r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        \&quot;%\&quot;: r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        \&quot;$\&quot;: r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        \&quot;#\&quot;: r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        \&quot;^\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;_\&quot;: r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        \&quot;{\&quot;: r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        \&quot;}\&quot;: r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;~\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    }\n    result = str(text)\n    for char, replacement in replacements.items():\n        result = result.replace(char, replacement)\n\n    # Escape standalone backslashes (not part of protected commands or escape sequences)\n    # Protect escape sequences first (like \\&amp;, \\%, etc.)\n    escape_sequences = [\n        r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    ]\n    protected_escapes = []\n    for i, esc in enumerate(escape_sequences):\n        marker = f\&quot;ESCAPESEQX{i}X\&quot;\n        protected_escapes.append((marker, esc))\n        result = result.replace(esc, marker)\n\n    # Now escape remaining standalone backslashes\n    result = result.replace(\&quot;\\\\\&quot;, r\&quot;\\textbackslash{}\&quot;)\n\n    # Restore protected escape sequences\n    for marker, esc in protected_escapes:\n        result = result.replace(marker, esc)\n\n    # Restore protected LaTeX commands\n    for idx, cmd in enumerate(latex_commands):\n        result = result.replace(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;, cmd)\n\n    return result\n\n\ndef &#39;{content_id}&#39; not found in variant &#39;{variant_id}&#39;\&quot;)\n\n    return paragraphs[content_id]\n\n\ndef load_shared_paragraph(para_type, content_id, content_dir):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load a paragraph from a shared content file.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    shared_content_path = (\n        content_dir / \&quot;cover_letters\&quot; / \&quot;paragraphs\&quot; / f\&quot;{para_type}.yaml\&quot;\n    )\n    if not shared_content_path.exists():\n        raise FileNotFoundError(\n            f\&quot;Shared paragraph file not found: {shared_content_path}\&quot;\n        )\n\n    shared_content = load_yaml(shared_content_path)\n    paragraphs = shared_content.get(\&quot;paragraphs\&quot;, {})\n\n    if content_id not in paragraphs:\n        raise KeyError(\n            f\&quot;Paragraph &#39;{content_id}&#39; not found in shared &#39;{para_type}&#39; paragraphs\&quot;\n        )\n\n    return paragraphs[content_id]\n\n\ndef load_cover_letter_variant(variant_id, config_dir, content_dir):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load a specific cover letter variant configuration and paragraphs.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    variant_config_path = config_dir / \&quot;cover_letters\&quot; / f\&quot;{variant_id}.yaml\&quot;\n    if not variant_config_path.exists():\n        raise FileNotFoundError(f\&quot;Variant config not found: {variant_config_path}\&quot;)\n\n    variant_config = load_yaml(variant_config_path)\n\n    # Load paragraph content\n    paragraphs = []\n    for para_ref in variant_config.get(\&quot;paragraphs\&quot;, []):\n        if para_ref.get(\&quot;source\&quot;) == \&quot;variant\&quot;:\n            para_content = load_variant_paragraph(\n                variant_id, para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        else:  # shared\n            para_content = load_shared_paragraph(\n                para_ref[\&quot;type\&quot;], para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        paragraphs.append(para_content)\n\n    return variant_config, paragraphs\n\n\ndef format_cover_letter_body(paragraphs, substitutions=None):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Format paragraphs into LaTeX body with proper spacing.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if substitutions is None:\n        substitutions = {}\n\n    formatted_paragraphs = []\n    for para in paragraphs:\n        text = para.get(\&quot;text\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;)\n        # Apply substitutions\n        for key, value in substitutions.items():\n            text = text.replace(f\&quot;[{key}]\&quot;, value)\n\n        # Escape LaTeX special characters (escape_latex now handles \\textbf{} commands)\n        escaped = escape_latex(text.strip())\n\n        formatted_paragraphs.append(escaped)\n\n    # Join with \\letterskip for consistent rhythm (matches resume section spacing)\n    return \&quot;\\\\letterskip\\n\\n\&quot;.join(formatted_paragraphs)\n\n\ndef generate_sections(content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, doc_type):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate LaTeX sections based on config.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    sections = []\n    section_order = config[doc_type][\&quot;sections\&quot;]\n\n    # Load core content files\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    summary_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;summary.yaml\&quot;)\n    experience_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;experience.yaml\&quot;)\n    education_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;education.yaml\&quot;)\n    skills_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;skills.yaml\&quot;)\n\n    # Load optional content files (with \&quot;certifications.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    projects_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;projects.yaml\&quot;)\n        if \&quot;templates\&quot; / \&quot;sections\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    for section_name in section_order:\n        if section_name == \&quot;summary\&quot;:\n            # Use different template title for leadership resume\n            if doc_type == \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;:\n                # Create a custom summary section with \&quot;Leadership Profile\&quot; title\n                summary_text = (\n                    summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    if summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    else summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]\n                )\n                leadership_profile = f\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tSECTION TITLE\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\cvsection{{Leadership Profile}}\n\n\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tCONTENT\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\begin{{cvparagraph}}\n{escape_latex(summary_text)}\n\\\\end{{cvparagraph}}\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n                sections.append(leadership_profile)\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;summary.tex\&quot;)\n                sections.append(\n                    template.render(summary_text=escape_latex(summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]))\n                )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;experience\&quot;:\n            template =   for entry in experience_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(experience_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name ==     leadership_skills = skills_data[\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;]\n                technical_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [\n content_optional_dir, config_dir, config, output_dir\n):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate a LaTeX document.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    # Load personal data\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    config_doc = config[doc_type]\n    project_root = (\n        content_core_dir.parent.parent\n    )  # content_core_dir is content/core, so parent.parent is project root\n\n    # Load base template\n    template_dir = Path(__file__).parent.parent / \&quot;templates\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    if doc_type == \&quot;resume\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_resume.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;],\n            sections=sections,\n        )\n\n        output_path = output_dir / \&quot;resume.tex\&quot;\n        output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        with open(output_path, \&quot;w\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n            f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cv\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cv.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cover_letter.tex\&quot;)\n        defaults = values\n            recipient_name = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, \&quot;Hiring Manager\&quot;)\n            )\n defaults.get(\n                    \&quot;company_address\&quot;, \&quot;Company Address\\nCity, State ZIP Code\&quot;\n                ),\n            )\n            company_address =         load_yaml(config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;)\n                if (config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n                else {}\n            )\n            letter_body = cover_letter_data.get(\&quot;body\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;letter_body\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n            letter_body = escape_latex(letter_body)\n\n            recipient_name = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, \&quot;Hiring Manager\&quot;)\n            )\n            company_name = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;company_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;company_name\&quot;, \&quot;Company Name\&quot;)\n            )\n            company_address = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;company_address\&quot;,\n                defaults.get(\n                    \&quot;company_address\&quot;, \&quot;Company Address\\nCity, State ZIP Code\&quot;\n                ),\n            ).replace(\&quot;\\n\&quot;, \&quot;\\\\\\\\\&quot;)\n            position_name = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;position_name\&quot;, font_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;font_size\&quot;],\n            paper_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;paper_size\&quot;],\n            margins=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;margins\&quot;],\n            color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;],\n            recipient_name=recipient_name,\n            company_name=company_name,\n            company_address=company_address,\n            position_name=position_name,\n            letter_opening=letter_opening,\n            letter_closing=letter_closing,\n config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;],\n            sections=sections,\n        )\n\n        output_path = output_dir / \&quot;leadership_resume.tex\&quot;\n        output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        with open(output_path, \&quot;w\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n            f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n\ndef main():\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Main entry point.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    script_dir = Path(__file__).parent\n    project_root = script_dir.parent\n    content_core_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;core\&quot;\n    content_optional_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;optional\&quot;\n    config_dir = project_root / \&quot;config\&quot;\n    output_dir = project_root / \&quot;generated\&quot;\n\n    # Check if content directories exist\n    if not sys.exit(1)\n\n    config = load_yaml(config_path)\n\n    # Generate documents\n    if len(sys.argv) &gt; 1:\n        doc_types = sys.argv[1:]\n    else:\n        doc_types = [\&quot;resume\&quot;, \&quot;cv\&quot;, \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;]\n\n    # Map command-line names to config keys\n    doc_type_map = {\n        \&quot;resume\&quot;: \&quot;resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cv\&quot;: \&quot;cv\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover-letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership-resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n    }\n\n    for doc_type_arg in doc_types:\n        doc_type = doc_type_map.get(doc_type_arg, doc_type_arg)\n        if doc_type in config:\n            generate_document(\n                doc_type,\n                content_core_dir,\n                content_optional_dir,\n                config_dir,\n                config,\n                output_dir,\n            )\n        else:\n            print(f\&quot;Unknown document type: {doc_type_arg}\&quot;)\n\n\nif __name__ == \&quot;__main__\&quot;:\n    main()\n&quot;
}

commands first using a marker without special chars\n    import re\n\n    latex_commands = []\n\n    def match_balanced_braces(s, start_pos):\n        \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Find the matching closing brace for an opening brace.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n        depth = 0\n        pos = start_pos\n        while pos &lt; len(s):\n            if s[pos] == \&quot;{\&quot;:\n                depth += 1\n            elif s[pos] == \&quot;}\&quot;:\n                depth -= 1\n                if depth == 0:\n                    return pos\n            pos += 1\n        return -1\n\n    # Find and protect re.search(r\&quot;\\\\([a-zA-Z]+)\\{\&quot;, text[pos:])\n        if not cmd_match:\n            result_parts.append(text[pos:])\n            break\n\n        cmd_start = pos + cmd_match.start()\n        cmd_name = cmd_match.group(1)\n        brace_start = cmd_start + len(cmd_match.group(0)) - 1  # Position of {\n\n        # Add text before the command\n        result_parts.append(text[pos:cmd_start])\n\n        # Find matching closing brace\n        brace_end = match_balanced_braces(text, brace_start)\n        if brace_end != -1:\n            # Extract full command\n            full_cmd = text[cmd_start : brace_end + 1]\n            idx = len(latex_commands)\n            latex_commands.append(full_cmd)\n            # Use marker without underscores or special chars\n            result_parts.append(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;)\n            pos = brace_end + 1\n        else:\n            # Malformed, just continue\n variant_id, para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        else:  # shared\n            para_content = load_shared_paragraph(\n                para_ref[\&quot;type\&quot;], para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        paragraphs.append(para_content)\n\n    return variant_config, paragraphs\n\n\ndef format_cover_letter_body(paragraphs, substitutions=None):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Format paragraphs into LaTeX body with proper spacing.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if substitutions is None:\n        substitutions = {}\n\n    formatted_paragraphs = []\n    for para in paragraphs:\n        text = para.get(\&quot;text\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;)\n        # Apply substitutions\n        for key, value in substitutions.items():\n            text = text.replace(f\&quot;[{key}]\&quot;, value)\n\n        # Escape LaTeX special characters (escape_latex now handles \\textbf{} commands)\n        escaped = escape_latex(text.strip())\n\n        formatted_paragraphs.append(escaped)\n\n    # Join with \\letterskip for consistent rhythm (matches resume section spacing)\n    return \&quot;\\\\letterskip\\n\\n\&quot;.join(formatted_paragraphs)\n\n\ndef generate_sections(content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, doc_type):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate LaTeX sections based on config.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    sections = []\n    section_order = config[doc_type][\&quot;sections\&quot;]\n\n    # Load core content files\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    summary_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;summary.yaml\&quot;)\n    experience_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;experience.yaml\&quot;)\n    education_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;education.yaml\&quot;)\n    skills_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;skills.yaml\&quot;)\n\n    # Load optional content files (with fallback to empty)\n    certifications_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;certifications.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;certifications.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    projects_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;projects.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;projects.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    languages_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;languages.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;languages.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    publications_data = (\n presentations_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;presentations.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;presentations.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    teaching_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;teaching.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;templates\&quot; / \&quot;sections\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    for section_name in section_order:\n        if section_name == \&quot;summary\&quot;:\n            # Use different template title for leadership resume\n            if doc_type == \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;:\n                # Create a custom summary section with \&quot;Leadership Profile\&quot; title\n                summary_text = (\n                    summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    if summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    else summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]\n                )\n                leadership_profile = f\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tSECTION TITLE\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\cvsection{{Leadership Profile}}\n\n\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tCONTENT\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\begin{{cvparagraph}}\n{escape_latex(summary_text)}\n\\\\end{{cvparagraph}}\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n                sections.append(leadership_profile)\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;summary.tex\&quot;)\n                sections.append(\n                    template.render(summary_text=escape_latex(summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]))\n                )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;experience\&quot;:\n            template =   for entry in experience_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(experience_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;education\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;education.tex\&quot;)\n            entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                [\n sections.append(template.render(education_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;skills\&quot;:\n            # Use a combined Skills / Certifications layout for leadership resume\n            if doc_type == \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot; and skills_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;):\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;skills_leadership.tex\&quot;)\n                leadership_skills = skills_data[\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;]\n                combined_skills = []\n                for skill in leadership_skills.get(\&quot;technical\&quot;, []):\n                    combined_skills.append(\n                        format_cvskill(skill[\&quot;category\&quot;], skill[\&quot;items\&quot;])\n                    )\n                for skill in                    )\n                sections.append(\n                    template.render(\n                        skill_entries=\&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(combined_skills),\n                    )\n                )\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;skills.tex\&quot;)\n                technical_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [\n                        format_cvskill(skill[\&quot;category\&quot;], skill[\&quot;items\&quot;])\n                        for skill in skills_data[\&quot;technical\&quot;]\n                    ]\n                )\n                professional_skills = \&quot;\&quot;\n                if skills_data.get(\&quot;professional\&quot;):\n                    professional_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                        [\n                            format_cvskill(skill[\&quot;category\&quot;], skill[\&quot;items\&quot;])\n                            for skill in skills_data[\&quot;professional\&quot;]\n              entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No projects entries found. Add entries to data/projects.yaml\&quot;\n                )\n            sections.append(template.render(project_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;publications\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;publications.tex\&quot;)\n            sections.append(\n                template.render(\n                    journal_articles=publications_data.get(\&quot;journal_articles\&quot;, []),\n                    conference_proceedings=publications_data.get(\n                        \&quot;conference_proceedings\&quot;, []\n                    ),\n                    preprints=publications_data.get(\&quot;preprints\&quot;, []),\n                )\n            )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;presentations\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;presentations.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = presentations_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;presentation\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = \&quot;% No presentations entries found. content_optional_dir, config_dir, config, output_dir\n):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate a LaTeX document.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    # Load personal data\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir root\n\n    # Load base template\n    template_dir = Path(__file__).parent.parent / \&quot;templates\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cover_letter.tex\&quot;)\n        defaults = font_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;font_size\&quot;],\n            paper_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;paper_size\&quot;],\n            margins=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;margins\&quot;],\n            color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n company_address=company_address,\n            position_name=position_name,\n            letter_opening=letter_opening,\n            letter_closing=letter_closing,\n f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n\ndef main():\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Main entry point.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    script_dir = Path(__file__).parent\n    project_root = script_dir.parent\n    content_core_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;core\&quot;\n    content_optional_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;optional\&quot;\n    config_dir = project_root / \&quot;config\&quot;\n    output_dir = project_root / \&quot;generated\&quot;\n\n    # Check if content directories exist\n    if not content_core_dir.exists():\n        print(\n            f\&quot;Error: Content directory not found at {content_core_dir}\&quot;, file=sys.stderr\n        )\n        sys.exit(1)\n\n    # Load config\n    config_path = config_dir / \&quot;documents.yaml\&quot;\n    if not config_path.exists():\n        print(f\&quot;Error: Config file not found at {config_path}\&quot;, file=sys.stderr)\n        sys.exit(1)\n\n    config = load_yaml(config_path)\n\n    # Generate documents\n    if len(sys.argv) &gt; 1:\n        doc_types = sys.argv[1:]\n    else:\n        doc_types = [\&quot;resume\&quot;, \&quot;cv\&quot;, \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;]\n\n    # Map command-line names to config keys\n    doc_type_map = {\n        \&quot;resume\&quot;: \&quot;resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cv\&quot;: \&quot;cv\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover-letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership-resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n    }\n\n    for doc_type_arg in doc_types:\n        doc_type = doc_type_map.get(doc_type_arg, doc_type_arg)\n        if doc_type in config:\n            generate_document(\n                doc_type,\n                content_core_dir,\n                content_optional_dir,\n                config_dir,\n                config,\n                output_dir,\n            )\n        else:\n            print(f\&quot;Unknown document type: {doc_type_arg}\&quot;)\n\n\nif __name__ == \&quot;__main__\&quot;:\n    main()\n&quot;
}
```

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Improving date range formatting**

I'm working on a helper function to format start and end dates more elegantly to avoid awkward " - " output when dates are missing. This will standardize date display for experience, education, and certification sections by replacing direct string interpolation with a reusable `format_date_range` function that handles all cases cleanly. I'll insert this helper near the top of `generate.py` and update relevant sections in `format_cventry`.</details></think>

  &quot;contentsAfterEdit&quot;: &quot;#!/usr/bin/env python3\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\nLaTeX Generator for CV/Resume/Cover Letter\nReads YAML data files and generates LaTeX documents using templates.\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n\nimport os\nimport yaml\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom jinja2 import Environment, FileSystemLoader, Template\nimport sys\n\n\ndef load_yaml(filepath):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load and parse a YAML file.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    with open(filepath, \&quot;r\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n        return yaml.safe_load(f)\n\n\ndef escape_latex(text):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Escape special LaTeX characters, but preserve LaTeX commands.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if not text:\n        return \&quot;\&quot;\n\n    # Protect LaTeX commands first using a marker without special chars\n    import re\n\n    latex_commands = []\n\n    def match_balanced_braces(s, start_pos):\n        \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Find the matching closing brace for an opening brace.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n        depth = 0\n        pos = start_pos\n        while pos &lt; len(s):\n            if s[pos] == \&quot;{\&quot;:\n                depth += 1\n            elif s[pos] == \&quot;}\&quot;:\n                depth -= 1\n                if depth == 0:\n                    return pos\n            pos += 1\n        return -1\n\n    # Find and protect all LaTeX commands like \\command{...}\n    result_parts = []\n    pos = 0\n    while pos &lt; len(text):\n        # Look for backslash followed by letters (LaTeX command)\n        cmd_match = re.search(r\&quot;\\\\([a-zA-Z]+)\\{\&quot;, text[pos:])\n        if not cmd_match:\n            result_parts.append(text[pos:])\n            break\n\n        cmd_start = pos + cmd_match.start()\n        cmd_name = cmd_match.group(1)\n        brace_start = cmd_start + len(cmd_match.group(0)) - 1  # Position of {\n\n        # Add text before the command\n        result_parts.append(text[pos:cmd_start])\n\n        # Find matching closing brace\n        brace_end = match_balanced_braces(text, brace_start)\n        if brace_end != -1:\n            # Extract full command\n            full_cmd = text[cmd_start : brace_end + 1]\n            idx = len(latex_commands)\n            latex_commands.append(full_cmd)\n            # Use marker without underscores or special chars\n            result_parts.append(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;)\n            pos = brace_end + 1\n        else:\n            # Malformed, just continue\n            result_parts.append(text[cmd_start:])\n            break\n\n    text = \&quot;\&quot;.join(result_parts)\n\n    # Basic LaTeX escaping\n    replacements = {\n        \&quot;&amp;\&quot;: r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        \&quot;%\&quot;: r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        \&quot;$\&quot;: r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        \&quot;#\&quot;: r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        \&quot;^\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;_\&quot;: r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        \&quot;{\&quot;: r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        \&quot;}\&quot;: r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;~\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    }\n    result = str(text)\n    for char, replacement in replacements.items():\n        result = result.replace(char, replacement)\n\n    # Escape standalone backslashes (not part of protected commands or escape sequences)\n    # Protect escape sequences first (like \\&amp;, \\%, etc.)\n    escape_sequences = [\n        r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    ]\n    protected_escapes = []\n    for i, esc in enumerate(escape_sequences):\n        marker = f\&quot;ESCAPESEQX{i}X\&quot;\n        protected_escapes.append((marker, esc))\n        result = result.replace(esc, marker)\n\n    # Now escape remaining standalone backslashes\n    result = result.replace(\&quot;\\\\\&quot;, r\&quot;\\textbackslash{}\&quot;)\n\n    # Restore protected escape sequences\n    for marker, esc in protected_escapes:\n        result = result.replace(marker, esc)\n\n    # Restore protected LaTeX commands\n    for idx, cmd in enumerate(latex_commands):\n        result = result.replace(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;, cmd)\n\n    return result\n\n\ndef format_date_range(start_date, end_date):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Return a clean date range string without extra separators.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if start_date and end_date:\n        return f\&quot;{start_date} - {end_date}\&quot;\n    if start_date:\n        return start_date\n    if end_date:\n        return end_date\n    return \&quot;\&quot;\n\n\ndef format_cventry(entry, entry_type=\&quot;experience\&quot;):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Format a single cventry for LaTeX.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if entry_type == \&quot;experience\&quot;:\n        title = escape_latex(entry.get(\&quot;title\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n        organization = escape_latex(entry.get(\&quot;organization\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n        location = escape_latex(entry.get(\&quot;location\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n        start_date = escape_latex(entry.get(\&quot;start_date\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n        end_date = escape_latex(entry.get(\&quot;end_date\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;))\n        date_range = format_date_range(start_date, end_date)\n\n        items = \&quot;\&quot;\n        if entry.get(\&quot;items\&quot;):\n            items = \&quot;{\\n      \\\\begin{cvitems}\\n\&quot;\n            for item in entry[\&quot;items\&quot;]:\n                items += f\&quot; load_cover_letter_variant(variant_id, config_dir, content_dir):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load a specific cover letter variant configuration and paragraphs.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    variant_config_path = config_dir / \&quot;cover_letters\&quot; / f\&quot;{variant_id}.yaml\&quot;\n    if not variant_config_path.exists():\n        raise FileNotFoundError(f\&quot;Variant config not entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;project\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No projects entries found. Add entries to data/projects.yaml\&quot;\n                )\n            sections.append(template.render(project_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;publications\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;publications.tex\&quot;)\n            sections.append(\n                template.render(\n                    journal_articles=publications_data.get(\&quot;journal_articles\&quot;, []),\n                    conference_proceedings=publications_data.get(\n                        \&quot;conference_proceedings\&quot;, []\n                    ),\n                    preprints=publications_data.get(\&quot;preprints\&quot;, []),\n                )\n            )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;presentations\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;presentations.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = presentations_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;presentation\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = \&quot;% No presentations entries found. Add entries to data/presentations.yaml\&quot;\n            sections.append(template.render(presentation_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;teaching\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;teaching.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = teaching_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;teaching\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No teaching entries found. Add entries to data/teaching.yaml\&quot;\n                )\n            sections.append(template.render(teaching_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;volunteer\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;volunteer.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = volunteer_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;volunteer\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No volunteer entries found. Add entries to data/volunteer.yaml\&quot;\n                )\n            sections.append(template.render(volunteer_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;languages\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;languages.tex\&quot;)\n            entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                [\n                    format_language(entry[\&quot;language\&quot;], entry[\&quot;proficiency\&quot;])\n                    for entry in languages_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(language_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;references\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;references.tex\&quot;)\n            sections.append(template.render())\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;leadership\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;leadership.tex\&quot;)\n            leadership_data = (\n                load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;leadership.yaml\&quot;)\n                if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;leadership.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n                else {\&quot;categories\&quot;: []}\n            )\n            leadership_entries = format_leadership_entries(leadership_data)\n            sections.append(template.render(leadership_entries=leadership_entries))\n\n    return \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(sections)\n\n\ndef generate_document(\n    doc_type, content_core_dir, / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    config_doc = config[doc_type]\n    project_root = (\n        content_core_dir.parent.parent\n    )  # content_core_dir is content/core, so parent.parent is project root\n\n    # Load base template\n    template_dir = Path(__file__).parent.parent / \&quot;templates\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    if doc_type == \&quot;resume\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_resume.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, \&quot;resume\&quot;\n        )\n\n        content = template.render(\n            name=personal[\&quot;name\&quot;],\n            position=personal[\&quot;position\&quot;],\n \&quot;\&quot;),\n            quote=personal[\&quot;quote\&quot;],\n            font_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;font_size\&quot;],\n            paper_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;paper_size\&quot;],\n            margins=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;margins\&quot;],\n            color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;],\n            sections=sections,\n        )\n\n        output_path = output_dir / \&quot;resume.tex\&quot;\n        output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        with open(output_path, \&quot;w\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n            f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cv\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cv.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, \&quot;cv\&quot;\n        )\n\n        content = template.render(\n            name=personal[\&quot;name\&quot;],\n color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;].get(\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;),\n            sections=sections,\n        )\n\n        output_path = output_dir / \&quot;cv.tex\&quot;\n        output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        with open(output_path, \&quot;w\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n            f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cover_letter.tex\&quot;)\n        defaults = config_doc.get(\&quot;defaults\&quot;, {})\n\n        # Determine variant (default to &#39;default&#39; if not specified)\n        variant_id = config_doc.get(\&quot;variant\&quot;, \&quot;default\&quot;)\n\n        # Try to load variant, fall back to old format if variant doesn&#39;t exist\n        try:\n            content_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot;\n substitutions = {\n                \&quot;Position Name\&quot;: variant_config.get(\&quot;position_name\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;),\n                \&quot;Company Name\&quot;: variant_config.get(\&quot;company_name\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;),\n            }\n            letter_body = format_cover_letter_body(paragraphs, substitutions)\n\n            # Use variant config values\n            recipient_name = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;recipient_name\&quot;, \&quot;Hiring Manager\&quot;)\n            )\n            company_name = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;company_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;company_name\&quot;, \&quot;Company Name\&quot;)\n            )\n            # Format address: company_address_raw.strip().replace(\&quot;\\n\&quot;, \&quot;\\\\\\\\\&quot;)\n            position_name = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;position_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;position_name\&quot;, \&quot;[Position Name]\&quot;)\n            )\n            letter_opening = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;letter_opening\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;letter_opening\&quot;, \&quot;Dear Hiring Manager,\&quot;)\n            )\n            letter_closing = variant_config.get(\n                \&quot;letter_closing\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;letter_closing\&quot;, \&quot;Sincerely,\&quot;)\n            )\n\n        except (FileNotFoundError, KeyError) as e:\n            # Fall back to old format for backward compatibility\n            print(\n                f\&quot;Warning: Variant &#39;{variant_id}&#39; not found, using legacy format: {e}\&quot;\n            )\n            cover_letter_data = (\n                load_yaml(config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;)\n                if (config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n                else {}\n            )\n Code\&quot;\n                ),\n            ).replace(\&quot;\\n\&quot;, \&quot;\\\\\\\\\&quot;)\n            position_name = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;position_name\&quot;, defaults.get(\&quot;letter_opening\&quot;, \&quot;Dear Hiring Manager,\&quot;)\n            )\n            letter_closing = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;letter_closing\&quot;, position=personal[\&quot;position\&quot;],\n            address=personal[\&quot;address\&quot;],\n            contact=personal[\&quot;contact\&quot;],\n            font_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;font_size\&quot;],\n            paper_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;paper_size\&quot;],\n            margins=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;margins\&quot;],\n            color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n company_address=company_address,\n            position_name=position_name,\n            letter_opening=letter_opening,\n            letter_closing=letter_closing,\n color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if - Generator support: added `format_date_range` to drop stray “ - ” when a role has no explicit dates and wired the leadership skills template into the `skills` branch so only the leadership packet gets the combined layout. Built artifacts live at `output/leadership_resume.pdf`.

```127:188:scripts/generate.py
def format_date_range(start_date, end_date):
    """Return a clean date range string without extra separators."""
    if start_date and end_date:
        return f"{start_date} - {end_date}"
    if start_date:
        return start_date
    if end_date:
        return end_date
    return ""

def format_cventry(entry, entry_type="experience"):
    ...
        date_range = format_date_range(start_date, end_date)
    ...
        return f"""%---------------------------------------------------------
  \\cventry
    {{{title}}}
    {{{organization}}}
    {{{location}}}
    {{{date_range}}}
    {items}"""
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="unknown" data-tool-name="apply_patch">

      {

  &quot;contentsAfterEdit&quot;: &quot;#!/usr/bin/env python3\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\nLaTeX Generator for CV/Resume/Cover Letter\nReads YAML data files and generates LaTeX documents using templates.\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n\nimport os\nimport yaml\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom jinja2 import Environment, FileSystemLoader, Template\nimport sys\n\n\ndef load_yaml(filepath):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load and parse a YAML file.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    with open(filepath, \&quot;r\&quot;, encoding=\&quot;utf-8\&quot;) as f:\n        return yaml.safe_load(f)\n\n\ndef escape_latex(text):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Escape special LaTeX characters, but preserve LaTeX commands.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if not text:\n        return \&quot;\&quot;\n\n    # Protect LaTeX commands first using a marker without special chars\n    import re\n\n    latex_commands = []\n\n    def match_balanced_braces(s, start_pos):\n        \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Find the matching closing brace for an opening brace.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n        depth = 0\n        pos = start_pos\n        while pos &lt; len(s):\n            if s[pos] == \&quot;{\&quot;:\n                depth += 1\n            elif s[pos] == \&quot;}\&quot;:\n                depth -= 1\n                if depth == 0:\n                    return pos\n            pos += 1\n        return -1\n\n    # Find and protect all LaTeX commands like \\command{...}\n    result_parts = []\n    pos = 0\n    while pos &lt; len(text):\n        # Look for backslash followed by letters (LaTeX command)\n        cmd_match = re.search(r\&quot;\\\\([a-zA-Z]+)\\{\&quot;, text[pos:])\n        if not cmd_match:\n            result_parts.append(text[pos:])\n            break\n\n        cmd_start = pos + cmd_match.start()\n        cmd_name = cmd_match.group(1)\n        brace_start = cmd_start + len(cmd_match.group(0)) - 1  # Position of {\n\n        # Add text before the command\n        result_parts.append(text[pos:cmd_start])\n\n        # Find matching closing brace\n        brace_end = match_balanced_braces(text, brace_start)\n        if brace_end != -1:\n            # Extract full command\n            full_cmd = text[cmd_start : brace_end + 1]\n            idx = len(latex_commands)\n            latex_commands.append(full_cmd)\n            # Use marker without underscores or special chars\n            result_parts.append(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;)\n            pos = brace_end + 1\n        else:\n            # Malformed, just continue\n            result_parts.append(text[cmd_start:])\n            break\n\n    text = \&quot;\&quot;.join(result_parts)\n\n    # Basic LaTeX escaping\n    replacements = {\n        \&quot;&amp;\&quot;: r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        \&quot;%\&quot;: r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        \&quot;$\&quot;: r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        \&quot;#\&quot;: r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        \&quot;^\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;_\&quot;: r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        \&quot;{\&quot;: r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        \&quot;}\&quot;: r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        \&quot;~\&quot;: r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    }\n    result = str(text)\n    for char, replacement in replacements.items():\n        result = result.replace(char, replacement)\n\n    # Escape standalone backslashes (not part of protected commands or escape sequences)\n    # Protect escape sequences first (like \\&amp;, \\%, etc.)\n    escape_sequences = [\n        r\&quot;\\&amp;\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\%\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\$\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\#\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\_\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\{\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciicircum{}\&quot;,\n        r\&quot;\\textasciitilde{}\&quot;,\n    ]\n    protected_escapes = []\n    for i, esc in enumerate(escape_sequences):\n        marker = f\&quot;ESCAPESEQX{i}X\&quot;\n        protected_escapes.append((marker, esc))\n        result = result.replace(esc, marker)\n\n    # Now escape remaining standalone backslashes\n    result = result.replace(\&quot;\\\\\&quot;, r\&quot;\\textbackslash{}\&quot;)\n\n    # Restore protected escape sequences\n    for marker, esc in protected_escapes:\n        result = result.replace(marker, esc)\n\n    # Restore protected LaTeX commands\n    for idx, cmd in enumerate(latex_commands):\n        result = result.replace(f\&quot;LATEXCMDX{idx}X\&quot;, cmd)\n\n    return result\n\n\ndef format_date_range(start_date, end_date):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Return a clean date range string without extra separators.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if start_date and end_date:\n        return f\&quot;{start_date} - {end_date}\&quot;\n    if start_date:\n        return start_date\n    if end_date:\n        return end_date\n    return \&quot;\&quot;\n\n\ndef format_cventry(entry,                    strength_entries=strength_entries,\n                        certification_entries=certification_entries,\n                    )\n                )\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;skills.tex\&quot;)\n                technical_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [\n                        format_cvskill(skill[\&quot;category\&quot;], skill[\&quot;items\&quot;])\n                        for skill in skills_data[\&quot;technical\&quot;]\n                    ]\n                )\n                professional_skills = \&quot;\&quot;\n                if skills_data.get(\&quot;professional\&quot;):\n                    professional_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                        [\n                            format_cvskill(skill[\&quot;category\&quot;], skill[\&quot;items\&quot;])\n                            for skill in skills_data[\&quot;professional\&quot;]\n                        ]\n                    )\n                sections.append(\n                    template.render(\n                        technical_skills=technical_skills,\n                        professional_skills=professional_skills,\n                    )\n                )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;certifications\&quot;:\n            template =          for entry in certifications_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(certification_entries=entries))\n\n        elif              entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No projects entries found. Add entries to data/presentations.yaml\&quot;\n            sections.append(template.render(presentation_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;teaching\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;teaching.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = teaching_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;teaching\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No teaching entries found. Add entries to data/teaching.yaml\&quot;\n                )\n            sections.append(template.render(teaching_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;volunteer\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;volunteer.tex\&quot;)\n            entries_list = volunteer_data.get(\&quot;entries\&quot;, [])\n            if entries_list:\n                entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [format_cventry(entry, \&quot;volunteer\&quot;) for entry in entries_list]\n                )\n            else:\n                entries = (\n                    \&quot;% No volunteer entries found.    template = env.get_template(\&quot;languages.tex\&quot;)\n            entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                [\n                    format_language(entry[\&quot;language\&quot;], entry[\&quot;proficiency\&quot;])\n                    for entry in languages_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n sections.append(template.render())\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;leadership\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;leadership.tex\&quot;)\n            leadership_data = (\n                load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;leadership.yaml\&quot;)\n                if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;leadership.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n                else / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    config_doc = config[doc_type]\n    project_root = (\n        content_core_dir.parent.parent\n    )  # content_core_dir is content/core, so parent.parent is project root\n\n    # Load base template\n    template_dir = Path(__file__).parent.parent / \&quot;templates\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    if doc_type == \&quot;resume\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_resume.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n                \&quot;true\&quot; if config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;section_color_highlight\&quot;] else \&quot;false\&quot;\n            ),\n            header_alignment=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;header_alignment\&quot;],\n            sections=sections,\n        )\n\n        output_path = output_dir / \&quot;resume.tex\&quot;\n print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cv\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cv.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, \&quot;cv\&quot;\n        )\n\n        content = template.render(\n            name=personal[\&quot;name\&quot;],\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n    elif doc_type == \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_cover_letter.tex\&quot;)\n        defaults = defaults.get(\&quot;letter_closing\&quot;, \&quot;Sincerely,\&quot;)\n            )\n\n        except (FileNotFoundError, KeyError) as e:\n            # Fall back to old format for backward compatibility\n            print(\n                f\&quot;Warning: Variant &#39;{variant_id}&#39; not found, using legacy format: {e}\&quot;\n            )\n            cover_letter_data = (\n                load_yaml(config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;)\n                if (config_dir / \&quot;cover_letter.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n                else {}\n            )\n Code\&quot;\n                ),\n            ).replace(\&quot;\\n\&quot;, \&quot;\\\\\\\\\&quot;)\n            position_name = cover_letter_data.get(\n                \&quot;position_name\&quot;, font_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;font_size\&quot;],\n            paper_size=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;paper_size\&quot;],\n            margins=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;margins\&quot;],\n            color=config_doc[\&quot;settings\&quot;][\&quot;color\&quot;],\n            section_color_highlight=(\n f.write(content)\n        print(f\&quot;Generated: {output_path}\&quot;)\n\n\ndef main():\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Main entry point.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    script_dir = Path(__file__).parent\n    project_root = script_dir.parent\n    content_core_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;core\&quot;\n    content_optional_dir = project_root / \&quot;content\&quot; / \&quot;optional\&quot;\n    config_dir = project_root / \&quot;config\&quot;\n    output_dir = project_root / \&quot;generated\&quot;\n\n    # Check if content directories exist\n    if not   config_path = config_dir / \&quot;documents.yaml\&quot;\n    if not config_path.exists():\n        print(f\&quot;Error: Config file not found at {config_path}\&quot;, file=sys.stderr)\n        sys.exit(1)\n\n    config = load_yaml(config_path)\n\n    # Generate documents\n    if len(sys.argv) &gt; 1:\n        doc_types = sys.argv[1:]\n    else:\n        doc_types = [\&quot;resume\&quot;, \&quot;cv\&quot;, \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;]\n\n    # Map command-line names to config keys\n    doc_type_map = {\n        \&quot;resume\&quot;: \&quot;resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cv\&quot;: \&quot;cv\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover-letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;: \&quot;cover_letter\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership-resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n        \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;: \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;,\n    }\n\n    for doc_type_arg in doc_types:\n        doc_type = doc_type_map.get(doc_type_arg, doc_type_arg)\n        if doc_type in config:\n            generate_document(\n                doc_type,\n                content_core_dir,\n                content_optional_dir,\n                config_dir,\n                config,\n                output_dir,\n            )\n        else:\n            print(f\&quot;Unknown document type: {doc_type_arg}\&quot;)\n\n\nif __name__ == \&quot;__main__\&quot;:\n    main()\n&quot;
}

```441:467:scripts/generate.py
            if doc_type == "leadership_resume" and skills_data.get("leadership_resume"):
                template = env.get_template("skills_leadership.tex")
                leadership_skills = skills_data["leadership_resume"]
                strength_entries = "\n".join(
                    [
                        format_cvskill(skill["category"], skill["items"])
                        for skill in leadership_skills.get("strengths", [])
                    ]
                )
                certification_entries = "\n".join(
                    [
                        format_cvskill(cert["category"], cert["items"])
                        for cert in leadership_skills.get("certifications", [])
                    ]
                )
                sections.append(
                    template.render(
                        strength_entries=strength_entries,
                        certification_entries=certification_entries,
                    )
                )
```

```1:18:templates/sections/skills_leadership.tex

<<strength_entries>>

\end{cvskills}

\cvsection{Certifications}

\begin{cvskills}

<<certification_entries>>

\end{cvskills}

\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load a paragraph from a shared content file.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    shared_content_path = (\n        content_dir / \&quot;cover_letters\&quot; / \&quot;paragraphs\&quot; / f\&quot;{para_type}.yaml\&quot;\n    )\n    if not shared_content_path.exists():\n        raise FileNotFoundError(\n            f\&quot;Shared paragraph file not found: {shared_content_path}\&quot;\n        )\n\n    shared_content = load_yaml(shared_content_path)\n    paragraphs = shared_content.get(\&quot;paragraphs\&quot;, {})\n\n    if content_id not in paragraphs:\n        raise KeyError(\n            f\&quot;Paragraph &#39;{content_id}&#39; not found in shared &#39;{para_type}&#39; paragraphs\&quot;\n        )\n\n    return paragraphs[content_id]\n\n\ndef load_cover_letter_variant(variant_id, config_dir, content_dir):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Load a specific cover letter variant configuration and paragraphs.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    variant_config_path = config_dir / \&quot;cover_letters\&quot; / f\&quot;{variant_id}.yaml\&quot;\n    if not variant_config_path.exists():\n        raise FileNotFoundError(f\&quot;Variant config not found: {variant_config_path}\&quot;)\n\n    variant_config = load_yaml(variant_config_path)\n\n    # Load paragraph content\n    paragraphs = []\n    for para_ref in variant_config.get(\&quot;paragraphs\&quot;, []):\n        if para_ref.get(\&quot;source\&quot;) == \&quot;variant\&quot;:\n            para_content = load_variant_paragraph(\n                variant_id, para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        else:  # shared\n            para_content = load_shared_paragraph(\n                para_ref[\&quot;type\&quot;], para_ref[\&quot;content_id\&quot;], content_dir\n            )\n        paragraphs.append(para_content)\n\n    return variant_config, paragraphs\n\n\ndef format_cover_letter_body(paragraphs, substitutions=None):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Format paragraphs into LaTeX body with proper spacing.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    if substitutions is None:\n        substitutions = {}\n\n    formatted_paragraphs = []\n    for para in paragraphs:\n        text = para.get(\&quot;text\&quot;, \&quot;\&quot;)\n        # Apply substitutions\n        for key, value in substitutions.items():\n            text = text.replace(f\&quot;[{key}]\&quot;, value)\n\n        # Escape LaTeX special characters (escape_latex now handles \\textbf{} commands)\n        escaped = escape_latex(text.strip())\n\n        formatted_paragraphs.append(escaped)\n\n    # Join with \\letterskip for consistent rhythm (matches resume section spacing)\n    return \&quot;\\\\letterskip\\n\\n\&quot;.join(formatted_paragraphs)\n\n\ndef generate_sections(content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, doc_type):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate LaTeX sections based on config.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    sections = []\n    section_order = config[doc_type][\&quot;sections\&quot;]\n\n    # Load core content files\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    summary_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;summary.yaml\&quot;)\n    experience_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;experience.yaml\&quot;)\n    education_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;education.yaml\&quot;)\n    skills_data = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;skills.yaml\&quot;)\n\n    # Load optional content files (with fallback to empty)\n    certifications_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;certifications.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;certifications.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    projects_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;projects.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;projects.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    languages_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;languages.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;languages.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    publications_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;publications.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;publications.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    presentations_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;presentations.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;presentations.yaml\&quot;).exists()\n        else {\&quot;entries\&quot;: []}\n    )\n    teaching_data = (\n        load_yaml(content_optional_dir / \&quot;teaching.yaml\&quot;)\n        if (content_optional_dir / \&quot;templates\&quot; / \&quot;sections\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    for section_name in section_order:\n        if section_name == \&quot;summary\&quot;:\n            # Use different template title for leadership resume\n            if doc_type == \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;:\n                # Create a custom summary section with \&quot;Leadership Profile\&quot; title\n                summary_text = (\n                    summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    if summary_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;)\n                    else summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]\n                )\n                leadership_profile = f\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tSECTION TITLE\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\cvsection{{Leadership Profile}}\n\n\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n%\tCONTENT\n%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\\\\begin{{cvparagraph}}\n{escape_latex(summary_text)}\n\\\\end{{cvparagraph}}\n\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n                sections.append(leadership_profile)\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;summary.tex\&quot;)\n                sections.append(\n                    template.render(summary_text=escape_latex(summary_data[\&quot;text\&quot;]))\n                )\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;experience\&quot;:\n            template =   for entry in experience_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(experience_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;education\&quot;:\n            template = env.get_template(\&quot;education.tex\&quot;)\n            entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                [\n                    format_cventry(entry, \&quot;education\&quot;)\n                    for entry in education_data[\&quot;entries\&quot;]\n                ]\n            )\n            sections.append(template.render(education_entries=entries))\n\n        elif section_name == \&quot;skills\&quot;:\n            # Use a narrative Skills &amp; Strengths layout for leadership resume\n            if doc_type == \&quot;leadership_resume\&quot; and skills_data.get(\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;):\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;skills_leadership.tex\&quot;)\n                leadership_skills = skills_data[\&quot;leadership_resume\&quot;]\n                strength_entries = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [\n                    strength_entries=strength_entries,\n                        certification_entries=certification_entries,\n                    )\n                )\n            else:\n                template = env.get_template(\&quot;skills.tex\&quot;)\n                technical_skills = \&quot;\\n\&quot;.join(\n                    [\n content_optional_dir, config_dir, config, output_dir\n):\n    \&quot;\&quot;\&quot;Generate a LaTeX document.\&quot;\&quot;\&quot;\n    # Load personal data\n    personal = load_yaml(content_core_dir / \&quot;personal.yaml\&quot;)\n    config_doc = config[doc_type]\n    project_root = (\n        content_core_dir.parent.parent\n    )  # content_core_dir is content/core, so parent.parent is project root\n\n    # Load base template\n    template_dir = Path(__file__).parent.parent / \&quot;templates\&quot;\n    # Use custom delimiters to avoid conflicts with LaTeX braces\n    env = Environment(\n        loader=FileSystemLoader(str(template_dir)),\n        variable_start_string=\&quot;&lt;&lt;\&quot;,\n        variable_end_string=\&quot;&gt;&gt;\&quot;,\n        block_start_string=\&quot;&lt;@\&quot;,\n        block_end_string=\&quot;@&gt;\&quot;,\n        comment_start_string=\&quot;&lt;#\&quot;,\n        comment_end_string=\&quot;#&gt;\&quot;,\n    )\n\n    if doc_type == \&quot;resume\&quot;:\n        template = env.get_template(\&quot;base_resume.tex\&quot;)\n        sections = generate_sections(\n            content_core_dir, content_optional_dir, config, \&quot;resume\&quot;\n        )\n\n        content = template.render(\n            name=personal[\&quot;name\&quot;],\n            position=personal[\&quot;position\&quot;],\n
